thread.title: Man dies after Wednesday morning shooting
thread.title_full: Man dies after Wednesday morning shooting

author: indystar.com
title: Man dies after Wednesday morning shooting
text:
Police tape. (Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto)
124 COMMENT EMAIL MORE An Indianapolis man has died after a shooting that fatally wounded him and critically injured another on the city's east side Wednesday.
Officers with the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department were dispatched to the 2300 block of North Dearborn Street just after 10:30 a.m. on reports of a person shot, where they found two men suffering from apparent gunshot wounds, according to a news release.
Both men were taken to Eskenazi Hospital in critical condition. One, identified as 28-year-old John Jones, later died.
Investigators learned there was a disturbance between Jones and another man. During that disturbance, police say Jones allegedly shot the man he was arguing with, at which time another person nearby shot Jones.
The man shot by Jones is still in the hospital in critical but stable condition, according to police. The man who shot Jones was questioned and released by officers.
Aggravated assault and homicide detectives are investigating the incident.
 Holly Hays at (317) 444-6156. Follow her on Twitter: @hollyvhays .
